√rāj 'be kingly'

present: [1.] rā́jati etc. V.+  rā́jate etc. E.+   -- [2.] rā́ṣṭi  rā́ṭ  

perfect: rarāja  rejus etc. E.+  rarājatus  reje etc. E.+  rarāje  

aorist: [1.] rājyāsam   -- [3.] ararājat   -- [5.] arājiṣus  arājiṣṭa  

[future: rājiṣyati  rājitā  ]

verbal: rājáse  

secondary: intensive: rāraj-   -- desiderative: rirājiṣa-   -- causative: rājayati etc. B.+  rājayate etc.  

derivatives: rā́j V.+  -rāja V.+  rā́jan V.+  rāján RV.  rājaná B.+  -rājin RV.E.  rā́ṣṭrī V.B.S.  rāṣṭrá V.+  

Is most probably an old denominative of rā́j 'ruler', from √ṛj, raj, which see. The anomalous stem irajyá- (see ib.) is related with it.
